title: 114_s2448
content: The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2016" establishes additional permanent bankruptcy judgeships in Delaware, Michigan, and Florida. Existing temporary bankruptcy judgeships will be converted as well. The Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2016 converts temporary bankruptcy judgeships in Delaware and Florida to permanent positions. The temporary bankruptcy judgeships in Maryland, Michigan, and Nevada are converted to permanent positions under the United States Code. The temporary bankruptcy judgeships in North Carolina and Puerto Rico are converted to permanent positions under the United States Code. Additionally, the temporary bankruptcy judgeship in Tennessee is also converted to a permanent position. The temporary bankruptcy judgeships in Tennessee and Virginia are converted to permanent positions under the United States Code. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AMENDMENTS. Section 152(a)(2) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to adjust the numerical values for various districts. Section 152(a)(2) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to adjust numerical values for districts, including increasing the values for Puerto Rico, the western district of Tennessee, and the eastern district of Virginia. The Act will be effective upon its enactment.
